sect1.title: GUI options
sect1.para: These options control the look and feel of darktable.
set the language of the user interface. the system default is marked with an * (needs a restart)
set the theme for the user interface

sect2.title: Import
sect2.bridgehead: ignore JPEG images when importing film rolls
sect2.para: When having RAW+JPEG images together in one directory it makes no sense to import both. With this flag one can ignore all JPEGs found (default off).
sect2.bridgehead: recursive directory traversal when importing film rolls
sect2.para: Not only import images from the directory selected but recursively go through all subdirectories as well (default off).
sect2.bridgehead: creator to be applied when importing
sect2.para: If provided, automatically add this string as a creator tag when importing images (default none).
sect2.bridgehead: publisher to be applied when importing
sect2.para: If provided, automatically add this string as a publisher tag when importing images (default none).
sect2.bridgehead: rights to be applied when importing
sect2.para: If provided, automatically add this string as a copyrights tag when importing images (default none).
sect2.bridgehead: comma separated tags to be applied when importing
sect2.para: If you want to add further tags when importing images, you can give them as a comma separated list (default none).
sect2.bridgehead: initial import rating
sect2.para: Initial star rating (from 0 to 5) for all images when importing a film roll (default 1).

sect2.title: Lighttable
sect2.bridgehead: don't use embedded preview JPEG but half-size raw
sect2.para: Check this option to not use the embedded JPEG from the raw file but process the raw data. This is slower. (default off).
sect2.bridgehead: high quality thumb processing from size
sect2.para: If the thumbnails size is greater than this value, it will be processed using the full quality rendering path which is better but slower (default 720p).
sect2.bridgehead: enable extended thumb overlay
sect2.para: If enabled adds additional information to the thumbnail under the mouse cursor: image name, exposure time, aperture, focal length, ISO value (default off).
sect2.bridgehead: use single-click in the collect panel
sect2.para: (default off). In single-click mode, you can select range of value directly with the mouse.
sect2.bridgehead: expand a single lighttable module at a time
sect2.para: Controls how lighttable panels are expanded. If this option is enabled, expanding a panel by clicking collapses any currently expanded panel. If you want to expand a panel without collapsing the others you do so with shift-click. Disabling this option reverts the meaning of click and shift-click (default off).
sect2.bridgehead: scroll to lighttable modules when expanded/collapsed
sect2.para: With this option enabled the lighttable side panels will scroll a module to the top when it is expanded or collapsed (default off).
sect2.bridgehead: rating an image one star twice will not zero out the rating
sect2.para: Normally clicking a one star rating twice will set a zero star rating to that image. When checking this option a second click on a one star rating will keep that rating (default off).

sect2.title: Darkroom
sect2.bridgehead: pen pressure control for brush masks
sect2.para: Controls how the pressure reading of a graphics tablet impacts newly generated brush strokes (see ). You can control the brush width, its hardness and its opacity. Absolute control means that the pressure reading directly defines the attribute with a value between 0% and 100%. Relative means that the pressure reading adjusts the attribute between zero and the pre-defined default value (default off).
sect2.bridgehead: smoothing of brush strokes
sect2.para: Sets the level for smoothing of brush strokes. Stronger smoothing leads to less nodes and easier editing at the expense of lower accuracy.
sect2.bridgehead: display of individual color channels
sect2.para: Controls how individual color channels are displayed when activated in the parametric masks feature. You can choose between false color and grey scale (default false color).
sect2.bridgehead: pattern for the image infos line
sect2.para: See for available values.
sect2.bridgehead: position of the image info line
sect2.para: Controls in which panel we display the image info line. You can choose between top left top right top center bottom and hidden (default bottom).
sect2.bridgehead: show search module text entry
sect2.para: Controls how to determine which modules are shown at the same time in the right panel. You can choose between groups icons search entry both (default both). (need a restart)
sect2.bridgehead: expand a single darkroom module at a time
sect2.para: Controls how darkroom modules are expanded. If this option is enabled, expanding a module by clicking collapses any currently expanded module. If you want to expand a module without collapsing the others you do so with shift-click. Disabling this option reverts the meaning of click and shift-click (default on).
sect2.bridgehead: expand the module when it is activated, and collapse it when disabled
sect2.para: This option allows to expand or collapse automatically modules when they are enabled or disabled. (default off)
sect2.bridgehead: scroll to darkroom modules when expanded/collapsed
sect2.para: With this option enabled the darkroom side panel will scroll a module to the top when it is expanded or collapsed (default on).
sect2.bridgehead: border around image in darkroom mode
sect2.para: Process the image in darkroom mode with a small border of the given number of pixels (default 20).

sect2.title: Map/geolocalisation
sect2.bridgehead: only draw images on map that are currently collected and filtered
sect2.para: Use the current filter settings to select the geotagged images drawn in the map view. This limits the images drawn to those currently shown in the filmstrip and thus reduces the time needed (default off).
sect2.bridgehead: maximum number of images drawn on map
sect2.para: The maximum number of geotagged images drawn on the map. Increasing this number can slow down the drawing of the map. Needs a restart if changed (default 100).
sect2.bridgehead: pretty print the image location
sect2.para: Show a more readable representation of the geo location in the image information module (default on).

sect2.title: Security
sect2.bridgehead: ask before removing images from database
sect2.para: Always ask the user before any image is removed from the database (default on).
sect2.bridgehead: ask before erasing images from disk
sect2.para: Always ask the user before any image file is deleted (default on).
sect2.bridgehead: send files to trash when erasing images
sect2.para: Instead of physically deleting images from disk put them into the system's trash bin (default on).
sect2.bridgehead: ask before moving images from film roll folder
sect2.para: Always ask the user before any image file is moved (default on).
sect2.bridgehead: ask before copying images to new film roll folder
sect2.para: Always ask the user before any image file is copied (default on).
sect2.bridgehead: ask before removing empty folders
sect2.para: Always ask the user before removing any empty folder. This can happen after moving or deleting images (default off).
sect2.bridgehead: ask before deleting a tag
sect2.para: Always ask user before deleting a tag from an image (default on).
sect2.bridgehead: ask before deleting a style
sect2.para: Always ask user before deleting a style (default on).

sect2.title: Miscellaneous
sect2.bridgehead: width of the side panels in pixels
sect2.para: This controls the size of side panels in pixels. Side panels are found left and right to the center view (default 350).
sect2.bridgehead: waiting time before each picture in slideshow
sect2.para: The number of seconds before displaying the next image (default 5).
sect2.bridgehead: do not show april 1st game
sect2.para: (default on).
sect2.bridgehead: number of folder levels to show in lists
sect2.para: The number of folder levels to show in film roll names, starting from the right (default 1).
sect2.bridgehead: enable filmstrip
sect2.para: Enable the filmstrip in darkroom, tethering, geomapping and lighttable culling modes (default on).
sect2.bridgehead: enable timeline
sect2.para: Enable the timeline lighttable mode (default on).
sect2.bridgehead: overlay txt sidecar over zoomed images
sect2.para: When there is a text file next to an image it can be shown as an overlay over zoomed images on the lighttable. The text file has the same base name as the image file with file extension .txt. It either has to be there at import time or the crawler has to be enabled – see option look for updated xmp files on startup in (default off).
sect2.bridgehead: mouse wheel scrolls modules side panel by default
sect2.para: When enabled, mouse wheel scroll modules side panel, and ctrl+alt+mouse wheel scroll data entry. When disabled, this behavior is reversed (default off).
sect2.bridgehead: show scrollbars for center view
sect2.para: Defines in which modes scrollbars should be displayed (default lighttable).
sect2.bridgehead: always show panels scrollbars
sect2.para: Defines whether the panel scrollbars should be always visible or activated only depending on the content (default on). (need a restart)
sect2.bridgehead: method to use for getting the display profile
sect2.para: This option allows to force a specific way of getting the current display profile for color management (see ). In the default setting all darktable will either query the X display server's xatom or the colord system service. You can set this option to xatom or colord to enforce a specific method if the alternative gives wrong results.
